Description: Gold bead made of two superimposed welded indented flower-shaped circles of five petals around a central circular hole.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the desert surface around the site.
Curator's comments: One of the gold "pieces of globule work (...) probably of chains" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "Gold bead of two pentagonal discs soldered together", p. 110, pl. xli, 14.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 14)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.83, p.186, pl.28)
